that sort of commutation is rather poor there's a fair change in current as you go past a break in the commutator and as

and the phase lock loop looks something as follows I use an up/down counter as
the phase comparator I mentioned that last time that's one technique for doing
a phase comparison you really keep track of the total number of cycles different between the commanded frequency and the
frequency that comes back in so what I do is apply a command proportional to

of pulses proportional to motor revolution in my particular system I use
a six bit up/down counter so I have resolution to a part in two to the sixth or a part in 64 I apply those six bits
